description: The snorkeller named Dirk was filmed exploring the seabed in Cape Peron in Perth, Western Australia, after he put his arm inside an underwater cave and an octopus latched on.
title: Perth snorkeller has a VERY close encounter with an octopus
title_page: Perth snorkeller has a VERY close encounter with an octopus | Daily Mail Online
text:
The mollusc held on for a few minutes and travelled up man's arm
An octopus latched on with mighty strength and refused to let go
The man came across an underwater cave and put his arm inside
Snorkeller was exploring seabed while on the lookout for lobster
A snorkeller on the lookout for spiny lobster got quite the surprise when another creature took a liking to him and became a little too attached.
The man named Dirk was filmed exploring the seabed in Cape Peron, a headland at Rockingham, at the southern end of Cockburn Sound in Perth, Western Australia.
He explained that he was searching for spiny lobster - also known as rock lobster - as they are particularly common in Australasia.
Stuck on you: The octopus latched on to Dirk's arm after he placed it inside an underwater cave
We shall not be moved: Dirk said it was quite a surprise when the mollusc held on with all its strength
After coming across a small underwater cave, Dirk could not help but put his arm inside and have a feel around for something alive.
It is at this point that an octopus latched onto his arm with all its strength - something that Dirk described as a surprise.
The video maker then captured the mollusc clinging onto the snorkeller's arm and refusing to let go.
The snorkeller explained how he attempted to remove the octopus for a couple of minutes and had several unsuccessful attempts at trying to pull it off.
Exploring: The octopus latched onto Dirk's lower arm before heading towards his shoulder
He said that when he did finally have some luck that the octopus moved over onto his other arm and held on tight.
The footage shows the majestic creature latched onto Dirk's arm with its suckers, as the snorkeller travels through the water.
It holds onto his lower arm before heading towards his shoulder and later moving back down again.
He explained that he was eventually able to remove the creature with a little probing and that it escaped to the grass on the seabed.
